{"step_by_step_thinking": "Normal ascension of kidney during embryological development is prevented by the superior mesenteric artery. This is because the superior mesenteric artery develops before the kidneys and can obstruct their ascent. Therefore, fusion of the poles of the kidneys inferiorly in Turner's syndrome would be consistent with abnormal development due to obstruction by the superior mesenteric artery.", "answer_choice": "A"}
